On a failure, the holder or wielder takes a -2 circumstance penalty to all checks that involve using the object; on a critical failure, the holder or wielder releases the item. The object lands in an adjacent square of the GM's choice. If you cast this spell on a worn object, the wearer gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Fortitude saves against attempts to grapple them.

spell->Mage Armor.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.aAbfKn8maGjJjk2W]
Armadura de mago
spell->Mage Armor.description:
You ward yourself with shimmering magical energy, gaining a +1 item bonus to AC and a maximum Dexterity modifier of +5. While wearing mage armor, you use your unarmored proficiency to calculate your AC.

Heightened (4th) You gain a +1 item bonus to saving throws.

Heightened (6th) The item bonus to AC increases to +2, and you gain a +1 item bonus to saving throws.

Heightened (8th) The item bonus to AC increases to +2, and you gain a +2 item bonus to saving throws.

Heightened (10th) The item bonus to AC increases to +3, and you gain a +3 item bonus to saving throws.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.qkwb5DD3zmKwvbk0]{Spell Effect: Mystic Armor}

spell->Mage Hand.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.pwzdSlJgYqN7bs2w]
Mano de mago
spell->Mage Hand.description:
You create a single magical hand, either invisible or ghostlike, that grasps the target object and moves it slowly up to 20 feet. Because you're levitating the object, you can move it in any direction. When you Sustain the Spell, you can move the object an additional 20 feet. If the object is in the air when the spell ends, the object falls.

Heightened (3rd) You can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 1 or less.

Heightened (5th) The range increases to 60 feet, and you can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 1 or less.

Heightened (7th) The range increases to 60 feet, and you can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 2 or less.
spell->Mage Hand.target: 1 unattended object of light Bulk or less

spell->Magic Missile.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]
Misil mágico
spell->Magic Missile.description:
You send a dart of force streaking toward a creature that you can see. It automatically hits and deals 1d4+1 force damage. For each additional action you use when Casting the Spell, increase the number of missiles you shoot by one, to a maximum of three missiles for 3 actions. You choose the target for each missile individually. If you shoot more than one missile at the same target, combine the damage before applying bonuses or penalties to damage, resistances, weaknesses, and so forth.

Heightened (+2) You shoot one additional missile with each action you spend.

spell->Message.name: Message
spell->Message.description:
You mouth words quietly, but instead of coming out of your mouth, they're transferred directly to the ears of the target. While others can't hear your words any better than if you normally mouthed them, the target can hear your words as if they were standing next to you.

The target can give a brief response as a reaction, or as a free action on their next turn if they wish, but they must be able to see you and be within range to do so. If they respond, their response is delivered directly to your ear, just like the original message.

Heightened (3rd) The spell's range increases to 500 feet.

spell->Shield.name: Shield
spell->Shield.description:
You raise a magical shield of force. This counts as using the Raise a Shield action, giving you a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn, but it doesn't require a hand to use.

While the spell is in effect, you can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.jM72TjJ965jocBV8]{Shield Block} reaction with your magic shield. The shield has Hardness 5. After you use Shield Block, the spell ends and you can't cast it again for 10 minutes. Unlike a normal Shield Block, you can use the spell's reaction against the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]{Force Barrage} spell.

Heightening the spell increases the shield's Hardness.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.Jemq5UknGdMO7b73]{Spell Effect: Shield}

Heightened (3rd) The shield has Hardness 10.

Heightened (5th) The shield has Hardness 15.

Heightened (7th) The shield has Hardness 20.

Heightened (9th) The shield has Hardness 25.

spell->True Strike.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Gb7SeieEvd0pL2Eh]
Golpe verdadero
spell->True Strike.description:
A glimpse into the future ensures your next blow strikes true. The next time you make an attack roll before the end of your turn, roll the attack twice and use the better result. The attack ignores circumstance penalties to the attack roll and any flat check required due to the target being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.fpGDAz2v5PG0zUSl]{Spell Effect: Sure Strike}

weapon->Staff.name: Staff
weapon->Staff.description: This long piece of wood can aid in walking and deliver a mighty blow.

equipment->Spellbook.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.FOWF5f0tCaApv9RE]
Libro de hechizos
equipment->Spellbook.description: A spellbook holds the written knowledge necessary to learn and prepare various spells, a necessity for wizards (who typically get one for free) and a useful luxury for other spellcasters looking to learn additional spells. Each spellbook can hold up to 100 spells. The Price listed is for a blank spellbook.

equipment->Thieves' Tools.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.zvLyCVD8g2PdHJAc]
Herramientas de ladrones
equipment->Thieves' Tools.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.zvLyCVD8g2PdHJAc]

Necesitas herramientas de ladrón para forzar cerraduras o desactivar dispositivos (de algunos tipos) usando la habilidad Robo.

Si las herramientas de tus ladrones están rotas, puedes repararlas reemplazando las ganzúas con @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Sw7MBLASN3xK4Y44]{Replacement Picks} apropiadas para tus herramientas; esto no requiere usar la acción Reparar.

consumable->Invisibility Potion.name: Invisibility Potion
consumable->Invisibility Potion.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.bikFUFRLwfdvX2x2]

Una poción de invisibilidad es incolora y extrañamente ligera. Al beberlo, obtienes los efectos de un hechizo de invisibilidad de segundo rango.

Mastermind.name: Cerebro
Mastermind.publicNotes:
Los cerebros tejen complots de largo alcance para ver sus nefastos objetivos hacerse realidad, manipulando hábilmente a quienes los rodean, convirtiendo a los enemigos en amigos y luego enfrentándolos entre sí. Cuando se compite en un ámbito social o intelectual, la mente maestra es un desafío de séptimo nivel.

Los villanos persiguen objetivos egoístas y crueles, pisoteando a cualquiera que sea lo suficientemente tonto o de corazón puro como para interponerse en su camino.

spell->Blur.name: Blur
spell->Blur.description: The target's form appears blurry. It becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}. As the nature of this effect still leaves the target's location obvious, the target can't use this concealment to Hide or Sneak.

spell->Invisibility.name: Invisibility
spell->Invisibility.description:
Cloaked in illusion, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}. This makes it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} to all creatures, though the creatures can attempt to find the target, making it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} to them instead. If the target uses a hostile action, the spell ends after that hostile action is completed.

Heightened (4th) The spell lasts 1 minute, but it doesn't end if the target uses a hostile action.

spell->Paranoia.name: Paranoia
spell->Paranoia.description:
You cause the target to see all other creatures as dire threats. The target is stricken by intense paranoia toward all creatures around it and must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target believes everyone it sees is a potential threat. It becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.I1ffBVISxLr2gC4u]{Unfriendly} to all creatures to which it wasn't already hostile, even those that were previously allies. It treats no one as an ally. The spell ends after 1 round.

Failure As success, but the effect lasts 1 minute.

Critical Failure As failure, except the target believes that everyone it sees is a mortal enemy. It uses its reactions and free actions against everyone, regardless of whether they were previously its allies, as determined by the GM. It otherwise acts as rationally as it normally does and likely prefers to attack creatures that are actively attacking or hindering it over those leaving it alone.

Heightened (6th) You can target up to 5 creatures.

spell->Charm.name: Charm
spell->Charm.description:
To the target, your words are honey and your visage seems bathed in a dreamy haze. It must attempt a Will save, with a +4 circumstance bonus if you or your allies recently threatened it or used hostile actions against it.

You can Dismiss the spell. If you use hostile actions against the target, the spell ends. When the spell ends, the target doesn't necessarily realize it was charmed unless its friendship with you or the actions you convinced it to take clash with its expectations, meaning you could potentially convince the target to continue being your friend via mundane means.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and aware you tried to charm it.

Success The target is unaffected but thinks your spell was something harmless instead of charm, unless it identifies the spell.

Failure The target's attitude becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.v66R7FdOf11l94im]{Friendly} toward you. If it was Friendly, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.v44P3WUcU1j0115l]{Helpful}. It can't use hostile actions against you.

Critical Failure The target's attitude becomes Helpful toward you, and it can't use hostile actions against you.

Heightened (4th) The duration lasts until the next time you make your daily preparations.

Heightened (8th) The duration lasts until the next time you make your daily preparations, and you can target up to 10 creatures.

spell->Daze.name: Daze
spell->Daze.description:
You cloud the target's mind and daze it with a mental jolt. The jolt deals mental damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier; the target must attempt a basic Will save. If the target critically fails the save, it is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Heightened (+2) The damage increases by 1d6.

spell->Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
spell->Detect Magic.description:
You send out a pulse that registers the presence of magic. You receive no information beyond the presence or absence of magic. You can choose to ignore magic you're fully aware of, such as the magic items and ongoing spells of you and your allies.

You detect illusion magic only if that magic's effect has a lower level than the rank of your detect magic spell. However, items that have an illusion aura but aren't deceptive in appearance (such as an invisibility potion) typically are detected normally.

Heightened (3rd) You learn the school of magic for the highest-level effect within range that the spell detects. If multiple effects are equally strong, the GM determines which you learn.

Heightened (4th) As 3rd level, but you also pinpoint the source of the highest-level magic. Like for an imprecise sense, you don't learn the exact location, but can narrow down the source to within a 5-foot cube (or the nearest if larger than that).

spell->Illusory Disguise.name: Illusory Disguise
spell->Illusory Disguise.description:
You create an illusion that causes you to appear as another creature of the same body shape, and with roughly similar height (within 6 inches) and weight (within 50 pounds), as yourself. The disguise is typically good enough to hide your identity, but not to impersonate a specific individual. The spell doesn't change your voice, scent, or mannerisms. You can change the appearance of your clothing and worn items, such as making your armor look like a dress. Held items are unaffected, and any worn item you remove returns to its true appearance.

Casting illusory disguise counts as setting up a disguise for the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.action-macros.Macro.k5nW4jGyXD0Oq9LR]{Impersonate: Deception} use of Deception; it ignores any circumstance penalties you might take for disguising yourself as a dissimilar creature, it gives you a +4 status bonus to Deception checks to prevent others from seeing through your disguise, and you add your level even if you're untrained. You can Dismiss this spell.

Heightened (2nd) The spell also disguises your voice and scent, and it gains the auditory and olfactory traits.

Heightened (3rd) You can appear as any creature of the same size, even a specific individual. You must have seen an individual to take on their appearance. The spell also disguises your voice and scent, and it gains the auditory and olfactory traits.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.3Ktyd5F9lOPo4myk]{Spell Effect: Illusory Disguise}

spell->Illusory Object.name: Illusory Object
spell->Illusory Object.description:
You create an illusory visual image of a stationary object. The entire image must fit within the spell's area. The object appears to animate naturally, but it doesn't make sounds or generate smells. For example, water would appear to pour down an illusory waterfall, but it would be silent.

Any creature that touches the image or uses the Seek action to examine it can attempt to disbelieve your illusion.

Heightened (2nd) Your image makes appropriate sounds, generates normal smells, and feels right to the touch. The spell gains the auditory trait. The duration increases to 1 hour.

Heightened (5th) As the 2nd-rank version, but the duration is unlimited.

spell->Inspire Competence.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.f0Z5mqGA6Yu79B8x]
Inspirar competencia
spell->Inspire Competence.description:
Your encouragement inspires your ally to succeed at a task. This counts as having taken sufficient preparatory actions to Aid your ally on a skill check of your choice, regardless of the circumstances. When you later use the Aid reaction, you can roll Performance instead of the normal skill check, and if you roll a failure, you get a success instead. If you are legendary in Performance, you automatically critically succeed.

The GM might rule that you can't use this ability if the act of encouraging your ally would interfere with the skill check (such as a check to Sneak quietly or maintain a disguise).

spell->Inspire Courage.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.IAjvwqgiDr3qGYxY]
Inspirar coraje
spell->Inspire Courage.description:
You inspire yourself and your allies with words or tunes of encouragement. You and all allies in the area gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, damage rolls, and saves against fear effects.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.beReeFroAx24hj83]{Spell Effect: Courageous Anthem}

spell->Message.name: Message
spell->Message.description:
You mouth words quietly, but instead of coming out of your mouth, they're transferred directly to the ears of the target. While others can't hear your words any better than if you normally mouthed them, the target can hear your words as if they were standing next to you.

The target can give a brief response as a reaction, or as a free action on their next turn if they wish, but they must be able to see you and be within range to do so. If they respond, their response is delivered directly to your ear, just like the original message.

Heightened (3rd) The spell's range increases to 500 feet.

spell->Prestidigitation.name: Prestidigitation
spell->Prestidigitation.description:
The simplest magic does your bidding. You can perform simple magical effects for as long as you Sustain the Spell. Each time you Sustain the Spell, you can choose one of four options.

  • Cook Cool, warm, or flavor 1 pound of nonliving material.
  • Lift Slowly lift an unattended object of light Bulk or less 1 foot off the ground.
  • Make Create a temporary object of negligible Bulk, made of congealed magical substance. The object looks crude and artificial and is extremely fragile-it can't be used as a tool, weapon, or spell component.
  • Tidy Color, clean, or soil an object of light Bulk or less. You can affect an object of 1 Bulk with 10 rounds of concentration, and a larger object a 1 minute per Bulk.

Prestidigitation can't deal damage or cause adverse conditions. Any actual change to an object (beyond what is noted above) persists only as long as you Sustain the Spell.

spell->Sigil.name: Sigil
spell->Sigil.description:
You harmlessly place your unique magical sigil, which is about 1 square inch in size, on the targeted creature or object. The mark can be visible or invisible, and you can change it from one state to another by using an Interact action to touch the target. The mark can be scrubbed or scraped off with 5 minutes of work. If it's on a creature, it fades naturally over the course of a week. The time before the mark fades increases depending on your heightened level.

Heightened (3rd) The sigil instead fades after 1 month.

Heightened (5th) The sigil instead fades after 1 year.

Heightened (7th) The sigil never fades.

weapon->Hand Crossbow.name: Hand Crossbow
weapon->Hand Crossbow.description: Sometimes referred to as an alley bow by rogues or ruffians, this small crossbow fires small bolts that are sometimes used to deliver poison to the target. It's small enough to be shot one-handed, but it still requires two hands to load.

weapon->Shortsword.name: Shortsword
weapon->Shortsword.description: These blades come in a variety of shapes and styles, but they are typically 2 feet long.

armor->Chain Shirt.name: Chain Shirt
armor->Chain Shirt.description: Sometimes called a hauberk, this is a long shirt constructed of the same metal rings as chainmail. However, it is much lighter than chainmail and protects only the torso, upper arms, and upper legs of its wearer.

equipment->Disguise Kit.name: Disguise Kit
equipment->Disguise Kit.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Jvp0x2Sc82WVpExT]

Esta pequeña caja de madera contiene cosméticos, vello facial postizo, goma de mascar y algunas pelucas sencillas. Por lo general, necesitas un kit de disfraz para disfrazarte y hacerte pasar por alguien usando la habilidad Engaño. Si has creado una gran cantidad de disfraces, puedes reponer tu suministro de cosméticos con cosméticos de repuesto adecuados para el tipo de tu kit de disfraces.

consumable->Bolts.name: Bolts
consumable->Bolts.description: Shorter than traditional arrows but similar in construction, bolts are the ammunition used by crossbows.

action->Versatile Performance.name: Rendimiento versátil
action->Versatile Performance.description:
El autor intelectual puede usar Actuación en lugar de Diplomacia para @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression} y ​​en lugar de Intimidación para @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} .

El autor intelectual también puede utilizar una actuación en lugar de un engaño para @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.AJstokjdG6iDjVjE]{Impersonate} .

action->Scoundrel's Feint.name: Finta de sinvergüenza
action->Scoundrel's Feint.description: Cuando el cerebro tiene éxito @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feints}, el objetivo es @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Desprevenido} contra los ataques cuerpo a cuerpo del cerebro hasta el final del siguiente turno del cerebro. En caso de éxito crítico, el objetivo queda desprevenido contra todos los ataques cuerpo a cuerpo durante ese tiempo, no solo los del autor intelectual.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.AWvNPE4U0kEJSL1T]

El cerebro inflige 1d6 de daño de precisión adicional a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Desprevenido} criaturas.

Merchant.name: Mercader
Merchant.publicNotes:
Los asentamientos pequeños normalmente pueden sustentar a uno o dos comerciantes generalistas, y las ciudades más grandes albergan múltiples especialistas-expertos en un tipo de producto. Los comerciantes se pueden encontrar en cualquier lugar: vendedores ambulantes en la plaza pública, comerciantes que dirigen pequeñas tiendas, vendedores ambulantes en carruajes o caravanas, o magnates ricos que dirigen organizaciones enteras dedicadas al comercio. Para encuentros que implican negociación o habilidad mercantil, un comerciante es un desafío de 4º nivel. Un comerciantepodría tener una habilidad de Conocimiento adicional sobre una categoría específica de artículo (como joyas o armas mágicas), con una bonificación de habilidad total 2 mayor que el Conocimiento Mercantil.

Todo asentamiento necesita comerciantes para crear nuevos productos, facilitar el comercio y evitar que la infraestructura se desmorone. Las ciudades más grandes suelen tener gremios enteros dedicados a la creación de bienes específicos, a gestionar las condiciones de los trabajadores y a trabajar con los gobiernos locales.

weapon->Crossbow.name: Crossbow
weapon->Crossbow.description: This ranged weapon has a bow-like assembly mounted on a handled frame called a tiller. The tiller has a mechanism to lock the bowstring in place, attached to a trigger mechanism that releases the tension and launches a bolt.

armor->Padded Armor.name: Padded Armor
armor->Padded Armor.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.zBYEU9E7034ENCmh]

Esta armadura es simplemente una capa de tela pesada y acolchada, pero a veces se usa porque es muy económica. La armadura acolchada es más fácil de dañar y destruir que otros tipos de armadura. La armadura pesada viene con una capa interna acolchada incluida en su precio, aunque pierde el rasgo de comodidad cuando se usa debajo de una armadura pesada. Puedes usar sólo esa armadura acolchada o abrigo interior para dormir, si tu armadura pesada esdestruido, o cuando no lleva la armadura pesada completa. Esto te permite mantener la armadura puesta y beneficiarte del poder de cualquier runa en la armadura pesada asociada, pero nadie más puede usar tu armadura pesada sin la capa interna acolchada.

consumable->Bolts.name: Bolts
consumable->Bolts.description: Shorter than traditional arrows but similar in construction, bolts are the ammunition used by crossbows.

action->Appraising Eye.name: Ojo evaluador
action->Appraising Eye.description: El comerciante puede utilizar el conocimiento mercantil para @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} sobre artículos, incluida la determinación de su valor. También pueden intentar @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.eReSHVEPCsdkSL4G]{Identify Magic} usando Mercantile Lore y pueden hacerlo sin saber primero si el objeto es mágico.

Miner.name: Minero
Miner.publicNotes:
Los mineros exploran las profundidades del subsuelo en busca de minerales y materiales raros, tomando numerosas precauciones para mantenerse a salvo.

Todos los días, los trabajadores realizan un trabajo físico agotador.

weapon->Pick.name: Pick
weapon->Pick.description: A pick designed solely for combat has a sturdy wooden shaft and a heavy, pointed head to deliver devastating blows.

armor->Miner's Harness.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.4tIVTg9wj56RrveA]
Arnés de minero
armor->Miner's Harness.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

equipment->Lantern (Hooded).name: Lantern (Hooded)
equipment->Lantern (Hooded).description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.dIRZ0LL7G31fJNYz]

Una linterna arroja luz brillante y requiere 1 litro de aceite para funcionar durante 6 horas. Una linterna en forma de diana emite su luz en un cono de 60 pies (y una luz tenue en los siguientes 60 pies). Una linterna con capota arroja luz en un radio de 30 pies (y luz tenue en los siguientes 30 pies) y está equipada con contraventanas que puede cerrar para bloquear la luz. Cerrar o abrir las contraventanas requiere una acción de Interactuar.

equipment->Piton.name: Piton
equipment->Piton.description: These small spikes can be used as anchors to make climbing easier. To affix a piton, you must hold it in one hand and use a hammer to drive it in with your other hand. You can attach a rope to the hammered piton so that you don't fall all the way to the ground on a critical failure while Climbing.

action->Piton Pin.name: Pin de Pitón
action->Piton Pin.description:
Requisitos El minero tiene su martillo en mano

Efecto El minero interactúa para dibujar un @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.oX39xqMLVB8kNrY0]{Piton}, luego lo clava en una criatura para inmovilizarla, intentando una prueba @Check[type:athletics|defense:reflex] contra la CD de reflejos del objetivo. En un impacto, el objetivo es @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Inmovilizado} hasta que retira el pitón con una prueba exitosa de @Check[type:athletics|dc:10|name:Remove Piton] realizada como acción de Interactuar.

Monster Hunter.name: Cazador De Monstruos
Monster Hunter.publicNotes:
Algunos mercenarios evitan las complicaciones de la política, los juramentos de servicio y la lealtad y simplemente les pagan por cazar monstruos. Es una forma sencilla de servicio mercenario, a menudo extremadamente peligrosa, pero que puede generar gloria y fama.

Una categoría amplia que incluye a aquellos que empuñan armas, hechizos o incluso astucia y astucia, los mercenarios se contratan a sí mismos y su experiencia a aquellos que tienen el oro para pagarlos.

weapon->Composite Longbow.name: Composite Longbow
weapon->Composite Longbow.description: This projectile weapon is made from horn, wood, and sinew laminated together to increase the power of its pull and the force of its projectile. Like all longbows, its great size also increases the bow's range and power. You must use two hands to fire it, and it cannot be used while mounted. Any time an ability is specifically restricted to a longbow, such as Erastil's favored weapon, it also applies to composite longbows unless otherwise stated.

weapon->Greataxe.name: Greataxe
weapon->Greataxe.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.8COlYvHe6hKCXY8x]

Esta gran hacha de batalla es demasiado pesada para manejarla con una sola mano. Muchas grandes hachas incorporan dos hojas y, a menudo, tienen "barba" y tienen un gancho en la parte inferior para aumentar la fuerza de su poder de corte.

armor->Hide Armor.name: Hide Armor
armor->Hide Armor.description: A mix of furs, sturdy hide, and sometimes molded boiled leather, this armor provides protection due to its layers of leather, though its bulkiness slows the wearer down and decreases mobility.

consumable->Arrows.name: Arrows
consumable->Arrows.description: These projectiles are the ammunition for bows. The shaft of an arrow is made of wood. It is stabilized in flight by fletching at one end and bears a metal head on the other.

action->Rage.name: Furia
action->Rage.description:
Requisitos El cazador de monstruos no es @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigado} ni está furioso

Efecto El cazador de monstruos gana 9 puntos de vida temporales que duran hasta que termina la ira. Mientras están furiosos, causan 8 daños adicionales con ataques cuerpo a cuerpo, obtienen una bonificación de estado de +10 pies a su velocidad y reciben una penalización de -1 a la CA. El cazador de monstruos no puede usar acciones concentradas excepto @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} y ​​rabia.comportamiento.

La ira dura 1 minuto, hasta que no haya enemigos que el cazador de monstruos pueda percibir, o hasta que el cazador de monstruos caiga inconsciente.

Una vez que termina la ira, el cazador de monstruos no puede volver a hacerlo durante 1 minuto.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.z3uyCMBddrPK5umr]{Effect: Rage}

action->Sudden Charge.name: Carga repentina
action->Sudden Charge.description: El cazador de monstruos da dos zancadas y realiza un ataque cuerpo a cuerpo.

Navigator.name: Navegador
Navigator.publicNotes:
Un navegante utiliza cuerpos celestes y rutas marítimas para determinar rutas. Para tareas que no sean de combate y que impliquen navegación o navegación, el navegante es un desafío de 4º nivel.

Los aventureros pueden necesitar pasaje en un barco rápido, o pueden enfrentarse al peligro de asaltantes en el mar o en asentamientos costeros.

weapon->Dagger.name: Dagger
weapon->Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

equipment->Scroll Case with Ship's Chart.name: Estuche de desplazamiento con cartas de barco

equipment->Writing Set.name: Writing Set
equipment->Writing Set.description: Using a writing set, you can draft correspondence and scribe scrolls. A set includes stationery, including a variety of paper and parchment, as well as ink, a quill or inkpen, sealing wax, and a simple seal. If you've written a large amount, you can refill your kit with extra ink and paper.

action->Chart a Course.name: Trazar un rumbo
action->Chart a Course.description:
Al dedicar 10 minutos de trabajo y tener éxito en una prueba @Check[type:sailing-lore|dc:22]{Sailing Lore}, el navegador traza un rumbo óptimo.

La severidad de las condiciones ambientales distintas de la temperatura se reduce en un paso durante 24 horas (dos pasos en caso de éxito crítico). Esto cambia el daño moderado a daño menor, los vientos que crean un terreno más difícil causan solo terreno difícil, y así sucesivamente.

action->Navigator's Edge.name: Borde del navegador
action->Navigator's Edge.description: El navegante reparte un [[/r {1d6}]]{1d6 weapon damage} adicional cuando está en un barco.

Necromancer.name: Nigromante
Necromancer.publicNotes:
Profanando el orden natural y escupiendo en contra de las convenciones, el nigromante permanece diligentemente comprometido a comprender qué fuerzas aguardan más allá de los límites mortales de la vida y la muerte.

Aquellos iniciados en las verdades ocultas y los secretos prohibidos del mundo se transforman para siempre, o eso afirman. Para el cínico, un místico no es más que un charlatán o un fanático. Otros afirman sentir un aura alrededor de tales luminarias y tratarlascon reverencia, para que no ofendan a algún presagio de una fatalidad indescriptible.

spellcastingEntry->Wizard School Spells.name: Hechizos de la escuela de magos

spell->Bind Undead.name: Bind Undead
spell->Bind Undead.description:
With a word of power, you seize control of the target. It gains the minion trait. If you or an ally uses any hostile actions against the target, the spell ends.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.rVkUzqS4rpZp9LS3]{Spell Effect: Bind Undead}
spell->Bind Undead.target: 1 mindless undead creature with a level no greater than bind undead's spell rank

spell->Lightning Bolt.name: Lightning Bolt
spell->Lightning Bolt.description:
A bolt of lightning strikes outward from your hand, dealing 4d12 electricity damage.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d12.

spell->Vampiric Touch.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.N1Z1oLPdBxaSgrEE]
Toque vampírico
spell->Vampiric Touch.description:
Your touch leeches the lifeblood out of a target to empower yourself. You deal 6d6 void damage to the target. You gain temporary Hit Points equal to half the void damage the target takes (after applying resistances and the like). You lose any remaining temporary Hit Points after 1 minute.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 2d6.

spell->False Life.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.8ViwItUgwT4lOvvb]
vida falsa
spell->False Life.description:
You create a reservoir of vitality from necromantic energy, gaining a number of temporary Hit Points equal to 6 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Heightened (+1) The temporary Hit Points increase by 3.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.PANUWN5xXC20WBg2]{Spell Effect: False Life}

spell->Mirror Image.name: Mirror Image
spell->Mirror Image.description:
Three illusory images of you swirl about your space, potentially causing those who attack you to hit one of the images instead of you. Any attack that would hit you has a random chance of hitting one of your images instead of you. If all three images remain, there is a 1 in 4 chance of hitting you (1 on [[/r 1d4]]). With two images remaining, there is a 1 in 3 chance of hitting you (1-2 on [[/r 1d6]]). With only one image, the chances are 1 in 2 (1-3 on [[/r 1d6]]).

Once an image is hit, it is destroyed. If an attack roll fails to hit your AC but doesn't critically fail, it destroys an image but has no additional effect (even if the attack would normally have an effect on a failure). If an attack roll is a critical success and would hit one of the images, one of the images is destroyed and the attack roll becomes a success against you. Once all the images are destroyed, the spell ends.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.0PO5mFRhh9HxGAtv]{Spell Effect: Mirror Image}

spell->Web.name: Web
spell->Web.description:
You create a sticky web in the area that impedes creatures' movement each time they try to move through it. Squares filled with the web are difficult terrain. Each square can be cleared of the web by a single attack or effect that deals at least 5 slashing damage or 1 fire damage. A square has AC 5, and it automatically fails its saving throws.

Each time a creature in the web begins to use a move action or enters the web during a move action, it must attempt an Athletics check or Reflex save against your spell DC to avoid taking a circumstance penalty to its Speeds or becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}. A creature that gets out of the web ceases to take a circumstance penalty to its Speed from the web.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected, and it doesn't need to attempt further Athletics checks or saving throws against the web this turn. If it used an Athletics check, it clears the web from every square it leaves after leaving the square.

Success The creature is unaffected during its action. If it used an Athletics check, it clears the web from every square it leaves after leaving the square.

Failure The creature takes a -10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds until the start of its next turn.

Critical Failure The creature is Immobilized until the start of its next turn, after which it takes a -10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds for 1 round. It can attempt to Escape to remove its Immobilized condition.

Heightened (4th) The spell's area increases to a 20-foot burst, and its range increases to 60 feet.

spell->Call of the Grave.name: Call of the Grave
spell->Call of the Grave.description:
You fire a ray of sickening energy. Make a spell attack roll.

Critical Success The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} as long as it's Sickened.

Success The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Failure The target is unaffected.

spell->Chill Touch.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.mAMEt4FFbdqoRnkN]
Toque frío
spell->Chill Touch.description:
Siphoning void energy into yourself, your hand radiates a pale darkness. Your touch weakens the living and disorients undead, possibly even causing them to flee. The effect depends on whether the target is living or undead.

  • Living Creature The spell deals void damage equal to 1d4 plus your spellcasting modifier. The target attempts a basic Fortitude save, but is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 round on a critical failure.
  • Undead Creature The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for 1 round on a failed Fortitude save. On a critical failure, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for 1 round unless it succeeds at a Will save.

Heightened (+1) The void damage to living creatures increases by 1d4.

spell->Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
spell->Detect Magic.description:
You send out a pulse that registers the presence of magic. You receive no information beyond the presence or absence of magic. You can choose to ignore magic you're fully aware of, such as the magic items and ongoing spells of you and your allies.

You detect illusion magic only if that magic's effect has a lower level than the rank of your detect magic spell. However, items that have an illusion aura but aren't deceptive in appearance (such as an invisibility potion) typically are detected normally.

Heightened (3rd) You learn the school of magic for the highest-level effect within range that the spell detects. If multiple effects are equally strong, the GM determines which you learn.

Heightened (4th) As 3rd level, but you also pinpoint the source of the highest-level magic. Like for an imprecise sense, you don't learn the exact location, but can narrow down the source to within a 5-foot cube (or the nearest if larger than that).

spell->Electric Arc.name: Electric Arc
spell->Electric Arc.description:
An arc of lightning leaps from one target to another. You deal electricity damage equal to 1d4 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d4.

spell->Fear.name: Fear
spell->Fear.description:
You plant fear in the target; it must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for 1 round.

Heightened (3rd) You can target up to five creatures.

spell->Feather Fall.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.TTwOKGqmZeKSyNMH]
Caída de pluma
spell->Feather Fall.description:
Trigger a creature within range is falling

You cause the air itself to arrest a fall. The target's fall slows to 60 feet per round, and the portion of the fall during the spell's duration doesn't count when calculating falling damage. If the target reaches the ground while the spell is in effect, it takes no damage from the fall. The spell ends as soon as the target lands.

spell->Grim Tendrils.name: Grim Tendrils
spell->Grim Tendrils.description:
Tendrils of darkness curl out from your fingertips and race through the air. You deal 2d4 void damage and [[/r (@item.level)[bleed]]] damage to living creatures in the line. Each living creature in the line must attempt a Fortitude save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half the void damage and no persistent bleed damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage.

Critical Failure The creature takes double void damage and double persistent bleed damage.

Heightened (+1) The void damage increases by 2d4, and the persistent bleed damage increases by 1.

spell->Ray of Enfeeblement.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.J7Y7tl0bbdz7TcCc]
Rayo de debilitamiento
spell->Ray of Enfeeblement.description:
A ray that saps a foe's strength flashes from your hand. Attempt a ranged spell attack against the target. If you succeed, that creature attempts a Fortitude save to determine the spell's effect. If your attack roll is a critical success, use the outcome for one degree of success worse than the result of its save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}.

Failure The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}.

Critical Failure The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3}.

spell->Ray of Frost.name: Ray of Frost
spell->Ray of Frost.description:
You blast an icy ray. Make a spell attack roll. The ray deals 2d4 cold damage.

Critical Success The target takes double damage and takes a -10-foot status penalty to its Speeds for 1 round.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.I4PsUAaYSUJ8pwKC]{Spell Effect: Ray of Frost}

Success The target takes normal damage.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d4.

spell->Read Aura.name: Read Aura
spell->Read Aura.description:
You focus on the target object, opening your mind to perceive magical auras. When the casting is complete, you know whether that item is magical, and if it is, you learn the school of magic.

If the object is illusory, you detect this only if the effect's level is lower than the rank of your read aura spell.

Heightened (3rd) You can target up to 10 objects.

Heightened (6th) You can target any number of objects.

spell->Shield.name: Shield
spell->Shield.description:
You raise a magical shield of force. This counts as using the Raise a Shield action, giving you a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn, but it doesn't require a hand to use.

While the spell is in effect, you can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.jM72TjJ965jocBV8]{Shield Block} reaction with your magic shield. The shield has Hardness 5. After you use Shield Block, the spell ends and you can't cast it again for 10 minutes. Unlike a normal Shield Block, you can use the spell's reaction against the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]{Force Barrage} spell.

Heightening the spell increases the shield's Hardness.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.Jemq5UknGdMO7b73]{Spell Effect: Shield}

Heightened (3rd) The shield has Hardness 10.

Heightened (5th) The shield has Hardness 15.

Heightened (7th) The shield has Hardness 20.

Heightened (9th) The shield has Hardness 25.

spell->Spider Sting.name: Spider Sting
spell->Spider Sting.description:
You magically duplicate a spider's venomous sting. You deal 1d4 piercing damage to the touched creature and afflict it with spider venom. The target must attempt a Fortitude save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target takes @Damage[1d4[poison]] damage.

Failure The target is afflicted with spider venom at stage 1.

Critical Failure The target is afflicted with spider venom at stage 2.

Spider Venom (poison)

Level 1

Maximum Duration 4 rounds

Stage 1 1d4 poison damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 1d4 poison damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 round)

weapon->Light Mace.name: Light Mace
weapon->Light Mace.description: A light mace has a short wooden or metal shaft ending with a dense metal head. Used much like a club, it delivers heavy bludgeoning blows, but with extra power derived from the head's metal ridges or spikes.

armor->Hooded Robe.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.dDIPA1WE9ESF67EB]
Túnica con capucha
armor->Hooded Robe.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.dDIPA1WE9ESF67EB]

La ropa del explorador es lo suficientemente resistente como para reforzarla para protegerte, aunque no sea una armadura. Viene en muchas formas, aunque las más comunes parecen vestimentas clericales, vestimentas de monje o túnicas de mago, ya que es probable que los miembros de las tres clases eviten usar armadura.

equipment->Spellbook (Abominable Missive.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.FOWF5f0tCaApv9RE]
Libro de hechizos (Abominables misivas de los atrofiados)
equipment->Spellbook (Abominable Missive.description: A spellbook holds the written knowledge necessary to learn and prepare various spells, a necessity for wizards (who typically get one for free) and a useful luxury for other spellcasters looking to learn additional spells. Each spellbook can hold up to 100 spells. The Price listed is for a blank spellbook.

consumable->Scroll of Spectral Hand (Lev.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Y7UD64foDbDMV9sx]
Pergamino de Mano Espectral (Nivel 2)
consumable->Scroll of Spectral Hand (Lev.consumableSpellDescription: You create a semicorporeal hand out of your essence that delivers touch spells for you. Whenever you Cast a Spell with a range of touch, you can have the hand crawl to a target within range along the ground, touch it, and then crawl back to you. When making a melee spell attack with the hand, you use your normal bonuses. The hand can move as far as it needs to within range. The hand has your AC and saves, but any damage to the hand destroys it and causes you to take 1d6 damage.
consumable->Scroll of Spectral Hand (Lev.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Y7UD64foDbDMV9sx]

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.rthC6dGm3nNrt1xN]{Ghostly Carrier}

Lanzar un hechizo desde un pergamino requiere sostener el pergamino en una mano y activarlo con una actividad de Lanzar un hechizo usando el número normal de acciones para ese hechizo.

Para lanzar un hechizo desde un pergamino, el hechizo debe aparecer en tu lista de hechizos. Como eres tú quien lanza el hechizo, usa tu tirada de ataque de hechizo ydeletrea DC. El hechizo también obtiene el rasgo apropiado para tu tradición (arcana, divina, oculta o primordial).

Todos los componentes materiales físicos y los costos se proporcionan cuando se crea un pergamino, por lo que no es necesario proporcionarlos al lanzar un hechizo a partir de un pergamino. Debes reemplazar cualquier componente material requerido para ese hechizo con un componente somático. Si el hechizo requiere un enfoque, debes tener ese enfoque para lanzar el hechizo desde un pergamino.

Nota: Para crear un pergamino o varita de un hechizo específico, arrastre el hechizo desde el compendio o navegador de compendio al inventario de un PC, NPC o actor de botín.

action->Stench of Decay.name: Hedor a descomposición
action->Stench of Decay.description: 5 pies. El nigromante emite un olor a podredumbre pútrida en una emanación de 5 pies. Una criatura que entra o comienza su turno en el aura es @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Indispuesto 1} .

action->Drain Bonded Item.name: Drenar artículo adherido
action->Drain Bonded Item.description:
Frecuencia una vez al día

Requisitos El nigromante aún no ha actuado en este turno

Efecto El nigromante gasta el poder almacenado en su maza. Esto les da la capacidad de lanzar un hechizo preparado que prepararon hoy y que ya lanzaron, sin gastar un espacio de hechizo.

Noble.name: Noble
Noble.publicNotes:
Envidiados por muchos y detestados por otros, los nobles exudan confianza y gentileza. Los chismes y los juegos de azar suelen ser los pasatiempos favoritos de los nobles. La vida cotidiana de un noble es a menudo una mezcla de negocios y ocio, y para un observador, ese estilo de vida puede parecer nada más que una serie de comidas, fiestas y salas de juego. Sin embargo, a pesar de lo que algunos puedan creer, la vida como noble es a menudo bastante peligrosa y requiere mucho más intelecto de lo que parece, además de una vida sana.dosis de sospecha.

Aunque los aventureros viajan a través de peligrosas mazmorras y traicioneras tierras salvajes, a veces el lugar más peligroso donde pueden terminar es en una corte noble.

weapon->Rapier.name: Rapier
weapon->Rapier.description: The rapier is a long and thin piercing blade with a basket hilt. It is prized among many as a dueling weapon.

equipment->Clothing (High-Fashion Fine).name: Clothing (High-Fashion Fine)
equipment->Clothing (High-Fashion Fine).description: Fine clothing, suitable for a noble or royal, is made with expensive fabrics, precious metals, and intricate patterns. You gain a +1 item bonus to checks to Make an Impression on nobility or other upper-class folk while wearing high-fashion fine clothing.

0.label: Ropa de alta costura (causar una impresión en la nobleza)

treasure->Loaded Dice.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.69IWSryF5BWkwWXY]
Dado cargado

action->Lip Reader.name: Lector de labios
action->Lip Reader.description: Después de años de meter la nariz donde no corresponde, el noble ha aprendido a leer los labios desde lejos, con los efectos de la hazaña @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.yUuU9xyotrpwpTyC]{Read Lips}.

action->Noble's Ruse.name: La artimaña de los nobles
action->Noble's Ruse.description:
Frecuencia Una vez por ronda

Efecto El noble @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feints} . Si tiene éxito, el noble ataca al objetivo.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.AWvNPE4U0kEJSL1T]

El noble inflige 1d6 de daño de precisión extra a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Desprevenido} criaturas.

spell->Bind Undead.name: Bind Undead
spell->Bind Undead.description:
With a word of power, you seize control of the target. It gains the minion trait. If you or an ally uses any hostile actions against the target, the spell ends.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.rVkUzqS4rpZp9LS3]{Spell Effect: Bind Undead}
spell->Bind Undead.target: 1 mindless undead creature with a level no greater than bind undead's spell rank

spell->Lightning Bolt.name: Lightning Bolt
spell->Lightning Bolt.description:
A bolt of lightning strikes outward from your hand, dealing 4d12 electricity damage.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d12.

spell->Vampiric Feast.name: Vampiric Feast
spell->Vampiric Feast.description:
Your touch leeches the lifeblood out of a target to empower yourself. You deal 6d6 void damage to the target. You gain temporary Hit Points equal to half the void damage the target takes (after applying resistances and the like). You lose any remaining temporary Hit Points after 1 minute.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 2d6.

spell->Acid Arrow.name: Acid Arrow
spell->Acid Arrow.description:
You conjure an arrow of acid that keeps corroding the target after it hits. Make a spell attack against the target. On a hit, you deal 3d8 acid damage plus @Damage[(floor(@item.rank/2))d6[persistent,acid]] damage. On a critical hit, double the initial damage, but not the persistent damage.

Heightened (+2) The initial damage increases by 2d8, and the persistent acid damage increases by 1d6.

spell->Blood Vendetta.name: Blood Vendetta
spell->Blood Vendetta.description:
Requirements You can bleed.

Trigger A creature deals piercing, slashing, or persistent bleed damage to you.

You curse the target, punishing it for having the audacity to spill your blood. The target takes 2d6 persistent bleed damage and must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target takes half the persistent bleed damage.

Failure The target takes the full persistent bleed damage. Until the bleeding stops, the target has weakness 1 to piercing and slashing damage. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.buXx8Azr4BYWPtFg]{Spell Effect: Blood Vendetta (Failure)}

Critical Failure As failure, but the target takes double the persistent bleed damage.

Heightened (+2) The persistent bleed damage increases by 2d6.

spell->Create Undead.name: Create Undead
spell->Create Undead.cost: black onyx, see Creature Creation Rituals table
spell->Create Undead.description:
You transform the target into an undead creature with a level up to that allowed in the Creature Creation Rituals table. There are many versions of this ritual, each specific to a particular type of undead (one ritual for all zombies, one for skeletons, one for ghouls, and so on), and the rituals that create rare undead are also rare. Some forms of undead, such as liches, form using their own unique methods and can't be created with a version of create undead.

Critical Success The target becomes an undead creature of the appropriate type. If it's at least 4 levels lower than you, you can make it a minion. This gives it the minion trait, meaning it can use 2 actions when you command it, and commanding it is a single action that has the auditory and concentrate traits. You can have a maximum of four minions under your control. If it's intelligent and doesn't become a minion, the undead is helpful to you for awakening it, though it's still a horrid and evil creature. If it's unintelligent and doesn't become a minion, you can give it one simple command. It pursues that goal single-mindedly, ignoring any of your subsequent commands.

Success As critical success, except an intelligent undead that doesn't become your minion is only friendly to you, and an unintelligent undead that doesn't become your minion leaves you alone unless you attack it. It marauds the local area rather than following your command.

Failure You fail to create the undead.

Critical Failure You create the undead, but its soul, tortured by your foul necromancy, is full of nothing but hatred for you. It attempts to destroy you.

Creatures Creation Rituals

Creature Level Spell Rank Required Cost
-1 or 0 2 15 gp
1 2 60 gp
2 3 105 gp
3 3 180 gp
4 4 300 gp
5 4 480 gp
6 5 750 gp
7 5 1,080 gp
8 6 1,500 gp
9 6 2,100 gp
10 7 3,000 gp
11 7 4,200 gp
12 8 6,000 gp
13 8 9,000 gp
14 9 13,500 gp
15 9 19,500 gp
16 10 30,000 gp
17 10 45,000 gp

spell->Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
spell->Dispel Magic.description: You unravel the magic behind a spell or effect. Attempt a counteract check against the target. If you successfully counteract a magic item, the item becomes a mundane item of its type for 10 minutes. This doesn't change the item's non-magical properties. If the target is an artifact or similar item, you automatically fail.
spell->Dispel Magic.target: 1 spell effect or unattended magic item

spell->Daze.name: Daze
spell->Daze.description:
You push into the target's mind and daze it with a mental jolt. The jolt deals 1d6 mental damage, with a basic Will save. If the target critically fails the save, it is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Heightened (+2) The damage increases by 1d6.

spell->Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
spell->Detect Magic.description:
You send out a pulse that registers the presence of magic. You receive no information beyond the presence or absence of magic. You can choose to ignore magic you're fully aware of, such as the magic items and ongoing spells of you and your allies. You detect illusion magic only if that magic's effect has a lower rank than the rank of your detect magic spell. However, items that have an illusion aura but aren't deceptive in appearance (such as an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.bikFUFRLwfdvX2x2]{Invisibility Potion}) typically are detected normally.

Heightened (3rd) You learn the rank or level of the most powerful magical effect the spell detects, as determined by the GM.

Heightened (4th) As 3rd rank, but you also pinpoint the source of the highest-rank magic. Like for an imprecise sense, you don't learn the exact location, but can narrow down the source to within a 5-foot cube (or the nearest if larger than that).

spell->Electric Arc.name: Electric Arc
spell->Electric Arc.description:
An arc of lightning leaps from one target to another. Each target takes 2d4 electricity damage with a basic Reflex save.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d4.

spell->Fear.name: Fear
spell->Fear.description:
You plant fear in the target; it must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for 1 round.

Heightened (3rd) You can target up to five creatures.

spell->Grim Tendrils.name: Grim Tendrils
spell->Grim Tendrils.description:
Tendrils of darkness curl out from your fingertips and race through the air. You deal 2d4 void damage and @Damage[(@item.level)[bleed]] damage to living creatures in the line. Each living creature in the line must attempt a Fortitude save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half the void damage and no persistent bleed damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage.

Critical Failure The creature takes double void damage and double persistent bleed damage.

Heightened (+1) The void damage increases by 2d4, and the persistent bleed damage increases by 1.

spell->Ray of Frost.name: Ray of Frost
spell->Ray of Frost.description:
You blast an icy ray. Make a spell attack roll. The ray deals 2d4 cold damage.

Critical Success The target takes double damage and takes a -10-foot status penalty to its Speeds for 1 round.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.I4PsUAaYSUJ8pwKC]{Spell Effect: Ray of Frost}

Success The target takes normal damage.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d4.

spell->Runic Weapon.name: Runic Weapon
spell->Runic Weapon.description:
The weapon glimmers with magic as temporary runes carve down its length. The target becomes a +1 striking weapon, gaining a +1 item bonus to attack rolls and increasing the number of weapon damage dice to two.

Heightened (6th) The weapon is +2 greater striking.

Heightened (9th) The weapon is +3 major striking.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.GnWkI3T3LYRlm3X8]{Spell Effect: Runic Weapon}
spell->Runic Weapon.target: 1 weapon that is unattended or wielded by a willing creature

spell->Shield.name: Shield
spell->Shield.description:
You raise a magical shield of force. This counts as using the Raise a Shield action, giving you a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn, but it doesn't require a hand to use.

While the spell is in effect, you can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.jM72TjJ965jocBV8]{Shield Block} reaction with your magic shield. The shield has Hardness 5. You can use the spell's reaction to reduce damage from any spell or magical effect, even if it doesn't deal physical damage. After you use Shield Block, the spell ends and you can't cast it again for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.Jemq5UknGdMO7b73]{Spell Effect: Shield}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.QF6RDlCoTvkVHRo4]{Effect: Shield Immunity}

Heightened (+2) The shield's Hardness increases by 5.

spell->Void Warp.name: Void Warp
spell->Void Warp.description:
You call upon the Void to harm life force. The target takes 2d4 void damage with a basic Fortitude save. On a critical failure, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} until the start of your next turn.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d4.

weapon->Nyctessa's Staff.name: Nyctessa's Staff
weapon->Nyctessa's Staff.description:
This macabre staff is crafted from gleaming white bone, a spinal column spiraling out of its base with a skull swinging from the spine's tip. It was handcrafted for Nyctessa by her father, a powerful Blood Lord, from her mortal mother's bones.

When you damage a creature with Nyctessa's staff, that creature gains weakness 2 to void damage until the end of your next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.HiLwUXS35dNZgnfC]{Effect: Sepulchral Drain}

Activate Cast a Spell

Effect You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

  • Cantrip @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.mAMEt4FFbdqoRnkN]{Void Warp}
  • 1st @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9WGeBwIIbbUuWKq0]{Summon Undead}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4koZzrnMXhhosn0D]{Fear}

armor->Explorer's Clothing.name: Explorer's Clothing
armor->Explorer's Clothing.description: Adventurers who don't wear armor travel in durable clothing. Though it's not armor and uses your unarmored defense proficiency, it still has a Dex Cap and can grant an item bonus to AC if etched with potency runes.

equipment->Spellbook.name: Spellbook
equipment->Spellbook.description: A spellbook holds the written knowledge necessary to learn and prepare various spells, a necessity for wizards (who typically get one for free) and a useful luxury for other spellcasters looking to learn additional spells. Each spellbook can hold up to 100 spells. The Price listed is for a blank spellbook.

consumable->Oil of Unlife (Lesser).name: Oil of Unlife (Lesser)
consumable->Oil of Unlife (Lesser).description:
Activate 1 (manipulate)

This thin, black liquid imparts a bone-deep chill while rapidly repairing an undead creature's physical or spiritual form. When you dash oil of unlife onto an undead creature, or a living creature with void healing, the oil absorbs quickly into its body, and the creature regains [[/r (2d8+5)[healing]]]{2d8+5 Hit Points}. You can pour oil of unlife on an incorporeal undead; in this case, the creature absorbs the oil into itself.

consumable->Void Salts.name: Void Salts
consumable->Void Salts.description:
Activate 1 envision

This sachet is filled with a fine powder that seethes with energy distilled directly from the Void. When used in casting a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.k34hDOfIIMAxNL4a]{Grim Tendrils} spell, void salts allow you to split the area of the spell, creating any number of lines originating from you that total 30 feet in length. A creature that multiple lines pass through is only affected once.

action->Adept Crafter.name: Adept Crafter
action->Adept Crafter.description: Nyctessa can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.rmwa3OyhTZ2i2AHl]{Craft} activity to create alchemical and magical items. In addition to her known spells, her spellbook contains the formulas for @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.p4ZEGzwteCB5fz6i]{Bottled Night}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.UqinuuCWePTYGhVO]{Antiplague (Lesser)}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.3Klm2gPmzOw6ntVb]{Comprehension Elixir (Lesser)}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.biHvCGfajSjUDGBS]{Steelscour (Moderate)}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.BSInwFNVBVkfFK0B]{Oil of Unlife (Lesser)}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.EGhUorZhB7nV73Ev]{Unholy Water}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.1gBkH409yTYM6jeZ]{Void Salts}.

action->Deathly Inquisition.name: Deathly Inquisition
action->Deathly Inquisition.description: Once per day, Nyctessa can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.FM3SmEW8N1FCRjqt]{Talking Corpse} as an innate occult spell on an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Inmovilizado} or willing undead creature (DC 21), with a casting time of 1 minute. This provides more detailed answers than speaking with a non-undead corpse.

action->Drain Bonded Staff.name: Drain Bonded Staff
action->Drain Bonded Staff.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Nyctessa expends the power stored in her staff. This turn she can cast one spell she prepared today and already cast, without spending a spell slot.

action->Sepulchral Drain.name: Sepulchral Drain
action->Sepulchral Drain.description:
When the Nyctessa's staff deals damage to a living creature with a Strike, that creature gains a weakness 2 to void damage until the end of Nyctessa's next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.HiLwUXS35dNZgnfC]{Effect: Sepulchral Drain}

action->Taste Blood.name: Taste Blood
action->Taste Blood.description:
Requirements Nyctessa's last action was a fangs Strike that damaged the target

Effect Nyctessa drinks blood from the target, which must be a living humanoid, gaining 5 temporary Hit Points for 10 minutes. The target must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:21] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drenado 1}. Regardless of the outcome, the target is temporarily immune to Nyctessa's Taste Blood for 1 day.

Palace Guard.name: Guardia de palacio
Palace Guard.publicNotes:
Cada palacio tiene sus porteros. Los guardias de palacio, a menudo descendientes más jóvenes de la nobleza menor o de una larga línea de personal de confianza, están a cargo de defender a la familia real y su fortaleza interior. Sus días consisten en proteger las puertas, escoltar a los nobles a varios lugares y mantener a los que están a su cargo lo más seguros posible. Las estadísticas siguientes corresponden al miembro de rango más bajo de la guardia palaciega de una nación pequeña; También funcionan bien para los guardias de élite de unnoble menor.

Aunque los aventureros viajan a través de peligrosas mazmorras y a través de traicioneras tierras salvajes, a veces el lugar más peligroso donde pueden terminar es en una corte noble.

weapon->Halberd.name: Halberd
weapon->Halberd.description: This polearm has a relatively short, 5-foot shaft. The business end is a long spike with an axe blade attached.

armor->Chain Mail with Palace Insignia.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Kf4eJEXnFPuAsseP]
Cota de malla con insignia de palacio
armor->Chain Mail with Palace Insignia.description: A suit of chain mail consists of several pieces of armor composed of small metal rings linked together in a protective mesh. It typically includes a chain shirt, leggings, a pair of arms, and a coif, collectively protecting most of the body.

equipment->Manacles (Simple).name: Manacles (Simple)
equipment->Manacles (Simple).description: You can manacle someone who is willing or otherwise at your mercy as an exploration activity taking 10-30 seconds depending on the creature's size and how many manacles you apply. A two-legged creature with its legs bound takes a -15-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds, and a two-handed creature with its wrists bound has to succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:5] any time it uses a manipulate action or else that action fails. This DC may be higher depending on how tightly the manacles constrain the hands. A creature bound to a stationary object is immobilized. For creatures with more or fewer limbs, the GM determines what effect manacles have, if any. Freeing a creature from simple manacles requires three successful @Check[thievery|dc:22|traits:action:pick-a-lock] checks.

action->Royal Defender.name: Defensor real
action->Royal Defender.description: Siempre leal, la guardia de palacio obtiene un bono de circunstancia +2 a las tiradas de ataque cuando defiende a su señor.

Pathfinder Field Agent.name: Agente de campo Pathfinder
Pathfinder Field Agent.publicNotes:
Esta mujer semielfa luce vestida para viajar a cualquier lugar y preparada para cualquier eventualidad que pueda encontrar en el camino.

No hay dos agentes de campo que sigan el mismo camino para unirse a la Sociedad Pathfinder, ni el mismo camino una vez que se embarcan en su primera expedición. Las traicioneras misiones de la Sociedad requieren todo tipo de aventureros, desde combatientes experimentados hasta buscadores de ruinas y expertos en lo oculto. Algunos agentes de campo están altamente especializados,desempeñando un solo rol en un grupo más grande de Pathfinders, mientras que otros se ramifican en una amplia gama de habilidades.

Este agente de campo busca la emoción de descubrir tesoros perdidos en las numerosas ruinas antiguas del Mar Interior. Ella explora hacia adelante en busca de su equipo, estando atenta a enemigos, trampas y otros peligros. En las peleas, es cautelosa y práctica, y prefiere mantenerse en movimiento y fuera de la vista. Ella se cuela para dar el golpe final cuando la victoria es segura.

La Sociedad Pathfinder es una organización grande e influyente que busca aprender y compartir sus conocimientos con otros, y sus miembros se pueden encontrar incluso en los lugares menos probables. Los PJ que son miembros de la Sociedad Pathfinder pueden acompañar a un agente de campo Pathfinder u recibir noticias y asignaciones de un capitán de aventura Pathfinder.
Pathfinder Field Agent.saveDetails: +1 circunstancia a todas las salvaciones contra trampas.

weapon->Rapier.name: Rapier
weapon->Rapier.description: The rapier is a long and thin piercing blade with a basket hilt. It is prized among many as a dueling weapon.

weapon->Shortbow.name: Shortbow
weapon->Shortbow.description: This smaller bow is made of a single piece of wood and favored by skirmishers and cavalry.

armor->Studded Leather Armor.name: Studded Leather Armor
armor->Studded Leather Armor.description: This leather armor is reinforced with metal studs and sometimes small metal plates, providing most of the flexibility of leather armor with more robust protection.

equipment->Thieves' Tools.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.zvLyCVD8g2PdHJAc]
Herramientas de ladrones
equipment->Thieves' Tools.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.zvLyCVD8g2PdHJAc]

Necesitas herramientas de ladrón para forzar cerraduras o desactivar dispositivos (de algunos tipos) usando la habilidad Robo.

Si las herramientas de tus ladrones están rotas, puedes repararlas reemplazando las ganzúas con @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Sw7MBLASN3xK4Y44]{Replacement Picks} apropiadas para tus herramientas; esto no requiere usar la acción Reparar.

consumable->Comprehension Elixir (Lesser.name: Comprehension Elixir (Lesser)
consumable->Comprehension Elixir (Lesser.description: This bitter draught opens your mind to the potential of the written word. For the listed duration after drinking this elixir, you can understand any words you read, so long as they are written in a common language. This elixir doesn't automatically allow you to understand codes or extremely esoteric passages-you still need to attempt a skill check to Decipher Writing. The duration is 1 minute.

consumable->Healing Potion (Minor).name: Healing Potion (Minor)
consumable->Healing Potion (Minor).description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.2RuepCemJhrpKKao]

Una poción curativa es un frasco de un líquido rojo rubí que imparte una sensación de hormigueo a medida que las heridas del bebedor sanan rápidamente. Cuando bebes una poción curativa, recuperas [[/r 1d8[healing]]] puntos de vida.

consumable->Infiltrator's Elixir.name: Infiltrator's Elixir
consumable->Infiltrator's Elixir.description:
Activate A Interact

Favored by spies and tricksters, an infiltrator's elixir is used to alter your appearance. When imbibed, you take the shape of a humanoid creature of your size, but different enough so you might be unrecognizable. If you aren't a humanoid, you might take on a form more similar to your own, at the GM's discretion. The creator of the elixir decides the basics of the appearance you transform into when you imbibe the elixir, including eye color, skin tone, and hair color. The elixir can't change your form into that of a specific person.

After the form takes hold, you retain it for the next 10 minutes. Drinking this elixir counts as setting up a disguise to Impersonate. You gain a +4 status bonus to your Deception DC to avoid others seeing through your disguise, and you add your level to this DC even if untrained.

consumable->Arrows.name: Arrows
consumable->Arrows.description: These projectiles are the ammunition for bows. The shaft of an arrow is made of wood. It is stabilized in flight by fletching at one end and bears a metal head on the other.

action->Scout's Warning.name: Advertencia del explorador
action->Scout's Warning.description:
Desencadenante El agente de campo está a punto de realizar una prueba de Percepción para determinar la iniciativa.

Efecto El agente de campo advierte de forma sonora o visual a sus aliados de un peligro inminente. Esta habilidad obtiene el rasgo auditivo si la advertencia es audible y el rasgo visual si la advertencia es visual. Cualquier aliado que pueda escuchar al agente (si la advertencia es audible) o ver al agente (si la advertencia es visual) gana un +1.bonificación de circunstancia a su tirada de iniciativa.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.RxDDXK52lwyHXl7v]{Effect: Scout's Warning}

action->Deny Advantage.name: Negar ventaja
action->Deny Advantage.description: El agente de campo no está @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Desprevenido} a criaturas que flanquean, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Escondido} o @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{No detectado} de nivel 4 o inferior, o a criaturas de nivel 4 o inferior usando un ataque sorpresa.

action->Mobility.name: Movilidad
action->Mobility.description: Cuando el agente de campo realiza una acción de Zancada para moverse a la mitad de su Velocidad o menos, ese movimiento no desencadena reacciones.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.AWvNPE4U0kEJSL1T]

El agente pionero inflige un daño de precisión adicional de 2d6 a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Desprevenido} criaturas.

action->Surprise Attack.name: Ataque sorpresa
action->Surprise Attack.description: En la primera ronda de combate, cualquier criatura que aún no haya actuado es @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Desprevenido} para el agente de campo.

action->Trap Finder.name: Buscador de trampas
action->Trap Finder.description: El agente de campo tiene un sentido intuitivo que le alerta de los peligros y presencia de trampas. Obtienen un bonificador de circunstancia +1 a las pruebas de Percepción para encontrar trampas, a la CA contra ataques realizados por trampas y a las salvaciones contra trampas. Incluso si no están buscando, reciben una verificación para encontrar trampas. Pueden desactivar trampas que requieren un rango de competencia de maestro en robo.

0.label: Buscador de trampas (detección o defensa contra trampas)

Pathfinder Venture-Captain.name: Capitán de aventura Pathfinder
Pathfinder Venture-Captain.publicNotes:
La armadura cubierta de percebes de este enano insinúa mil historias emocionantes.

Los capitanes de riesgo de la Sociedad Pathfinder ascendieron en las filas de la organización siguiendo un camino único. Un capitán de empresa individual ha superado numerosos desafíos, y cada uno tiene innumerables historias que contar, y las cicatrices que las acompañan. Cada capitán de aventura mantiene un albergue en algún lugar del Mar Interior, donde los agentes Pathfinder pueden descansar, compartirhistorias y emprender nuevas misiones. El capitán de la empresa asigna estas misiones él mismo y puede recurrir a los importantes recursos de la Sociedad Pathfinder, así como a cualquier aliado local que tenga, para garantizar el éxito de las misiones.

Este capitán de riesgo opera un albergue que también sirve como taberna. Su interés por los cuentos épicos lo llevó a unirse a la Sociedad y con gusto comparte estas historias con las partes interesadas. Los agentes de campo oportunistas pueden obtener lael favor del capitán de riesgo al recuperar licores únicos y valiosos. El capitán de la empresa espera publicar algún día su propia Crónica Pathfinder.

La Sociedad Pathfinder es una organización grande e influyente que busca aprender y compartir sus conocimientos con otros, y sus miembros se pueden encontrar incluso en los lugares menos probables. Los PJ que son miembros de la Sociedad Pathfinder pueden acompañar a un agente de campo Pathfinder u obtener noticias y asignaciones de unCapitán de aventura Pathfinder.

spell->Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
spell->Detect Magic.description:
You send out a pulse that registers the presence of magic. You receive no information beyond the presence or absence of magic. You can choose to ignore magic you're fully aware of, such as the magic items and ongoing spells of you and your allies.

You detect illusion magic only if that magic's effect has a lower level than the rank of your detect magic spell. However, items that have an illusion aura but aren't deceptive in appearance (such as an invisibility potion) typically are detected normally.

Heightened (3rd) You learn the school of magic for the highest-level effect within range that the spell detects. If multiple effects are equally strong, the GM determines which you learn.

Heightened (4th) As 3rd level, but you also pinpoint the source of the highest-level magic. Like for an imprecise sense, you don't learn the exact location, but can narrow down the source to within a 5-foot cube (or the nearest if larger than that).

spell->Inspire Competence.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.f0Z5mqGA6Yu79B8x]
Inspirar competencia
spell->Inspire Competence.description:
Your encouragement inspires your ally to succeed at a task.
